title: Gemstone Identification
description: Identify gemstones from descriptions and properties

questions.question: Which precious gemstone is the hardest natural substance on Earth, rating 10 on the Mohs scale?
Which green gemstone was Cleopatra's favorite, is known for its inclusions called 'jardins,' and is the birthstone for May?
Which gemstone is a variety of corundum, comes in every color except red, and is the birthstone for September?
Which red gemstone is also a variety of corundum and has historically been called the 'king of gems'?
Which iridescent gemstone is formed inside mollusks and is the only gem created by a living organism?
Which gemstone displays a stunning play of color with rainbow-like flashes and is the national gemstone of Australia?
Which purple gemstone is a variety of quartz and was once considered as valuable as diamonds?
Which blue-violet gemstone was discovered in Tanzania in 1967 and is found nowhere else on Earth?
Which golden-yellow gemstone is fossilized tree resin, sometimes containing preserved ancient insects?
Which deep blue gemstone has been prized since antiquity, was ground into ultramarine pigment by Renaissance painters, and often contains flecks of golden pyrite?
Which gemstone is known for its cat's-eye effect, comes in honey-brown to greenish colors, and is believed to bring good luck?
Which gemstone appears green in daylight but changes to red under incandescent light, and is named after a Russian tsar?
Which light green gemstone is sometimes called 'the evening emerald,' is found in volcanic rock, and is the birthstone for August?
Which gemstone comes in virtually every color, has varieties called 'watermelon' and 'Paraiba,' and has strong pleochroism?
Which ornamental stone has been carved and revered in China for thousands of years, comes in nephrite and jadeite varieties, and symbolizes purity and wisdom?
